item.title: 8 Best Horror Games With Multiple Endings, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Horror games with multiple endings encourage replayability & decision-making.
  • Variety in endings can lead to different outcomes, adding value and fun to the game.
  • Each game offers unique endings based on player choices, enhancing the overall experience.

When a horror game offers multiple endings, it encourages players to think a little more about how they play, considering a lot of these final scenes can only be seen by meeting certain conditions within the game itself. Having more than one finale also means the developers can get a little more creative and experimental, since while one may be considered the 'canon' ending, there can still be several ways the protagonist's nightmarish journey can end, whether it be on a hopeful or more terrifying note.

Of course, being able to unlock more than one ending also adds a lot to the replay value, since it's always a ton of fun seeing all the unique ways the story can end, especially if there are also some joke or bad endings thrown in. The game itself still needs to be enjoyable to play through to incentivize players to earn these endings, and thankfully, there are plenty of excellent horror games that fit this description.

8 The Walking Dead Season 2

Clementine Will Be Forced To Decide How To Deal With Kenny As He Grows More And More Unpredictable

Your comment has not been saved

Telltale's The Walking Dead Season 2
8.7 /10
Released
December 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Telltale Games
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, PlayStation 4, PC, Android, PS3, iOS, Xbox 360
Powered by

Initially, Clementine is overjoyed to reunite with Kenny in season 2 of Telltale's The Walking Dead series, considering she spent so much time around him in the first game, but it soon becomes clear that the grizzled survivor is struggling to hold himself together. Kenny's emotions constantly get the better of him, and after being tricked by Jane, Kenny ends up trying to strangle her, forcing players to decide whether to shoot him or not in the closing moments of the game, depending on how they feel about him as a character.

There will even be extra endings that can be unlocked after this final fight occurs, which will all see Clementine and AJ ending up in entirely different scenarios after the journey finally ends. The game excels at getting players invested in the characters before throwing brutally difficult choices their way, and with seven endings in total to see, the game is packed full of replay value, especially with how many different outcomes there are to see with each chapter.

7 Project Zero 2: Wii Edition

The Wii Edition Of Fatal Frame 2 Contains All Possible Endings For This Beloved Entry In The Franchise

Your comment has not been saved

Project Zero 2: Wii Edition
Survival Horror
Systems
Released
June 28, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Tecmo Koei Games
Platform(s)
Wii
Powered by

The original Fatal Frame 2 only included a total of three endings, but this number was bumped up to four with the Xbox version, and eventually six with the Wii remake. With how fast and dangerous the ghosts in this game are, it makes a typical playthrough pretty challenging, and as a result, the difficulty players decide to go with will have a big impact on how the final few scenes play out.

There are, however, many other creative ways that players can end the game, such as seeking out a hidden passageway, for example, to leave the forest behind them for good. The entire game leads up to the moment where Mio and Mayu must decide how to deal with a cursed ritual which has been placed on them due to being twins, resulting in a very compelling story packed full of haunting imagery and fascinating characters to explore.

6 Until Dawn

Keeping Everyone Alive Until Dawn Might Be Considered The Good Ending, But It's No Easy Task

Your comment has not been saved

Until Dawn
8 /10
10
9 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 79 /100 Critics Rec: 49%
Released
August 25, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Supermassive Games
Platform(s)
PS4
Powered by

The first few choices players will have to make in Until Dawn won't have too big of a long-lasting consequence, but once the real enemies of the game start to show themselves, it's not an understatement to say almost every decision matters. After a group of teens finds themselves on a mountain occupied by not only a killer, but also a batch of cannibalistic Wendigo, they must try to survive the ordeal until dawn, which is when the evacuation team is set to arrive.

The reason Until Dawn has become such a cult classic is because of how honest it is when it comes to abiding by its commitment to killing off characters. One fatal slip-up and a survivor won't be there to see the sun rise at the end, which can result in entirely different conversations between the characters, and even different scenes entirely, especially in the remake, where more of them have been added.

5 Haunting Ground

Whether Fiona Escapes The Castle Or Not Depends On A Few Specific Factors

Your comment has not been saved

Haunting Ground
9 /10
Released
May 10, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS2, PS3
Powered by

Haunting Ground is a game that many survival horror fans have been begging Capcom to bring back in some form or another, and it's because of how unique this title is in terms of gameplay. While the main protagonist, Fiona, is completely defenseless, she does still have her loyal canine companion Hewie to help her out, resulting in a fun and frantic gameplay loop where players must do all they can to evade a swarm of dangerous stalker enemies along their journey.

The game features four endings, which can all be unlocked through fairly simple requirements, but one of the major factors is how players treat Hewie. If he's continuously ignored and thrown into danger, Hewie won't be there to save Fiona near the very end, resulting in the bad ending. Haunting Ground is a game that is so much fun to replay, not just for its multiple endings, but also due to the creative gameplay formula and the incredible setting of the castle.

4 Amnesia: The Dark Descent

The Climax To Daniel's Adventure Into Darkness Can Be Influenced Once Players Enter The Sanctum

Your comment has not been saved

Amnesia: The Dark Descent
9.5 /10
Released
September 8, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Frictional Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, Android, Xbox One, Microsoft Windows, macOS
Powered by

Though the game is excellent in its own right, Amnesia: The Dark Descent really became a household name thanks to how much it was played by streamers. One of the most exciting parts of watching someone play, aside from the jump scare reactions, is seeing which of the three possible endings they will receive, which all depends on how the player acts in the final area of the game, The Sanctum.

Upon finally confronting Alexander, who has been manipulating Daniel for much of the story, players are forced to decide what to do with him once he begins conjuring up a mysterious portal. Amnesia: The Dark Descent is a game that feels scarily real thanks to the inclusion of the sanity bar and the attention to using darkness as a way to avoid monsters, so having multiple endings provides a great excuse to run through this horror classic one more time.

3 Dead Rising

It's Up To Players Whether Frank Will Get His Precious Scoop In One Piece Or Not

Your comment has not been saved

Dead Rising
8 /10
Released
August 8, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, Xbox 360, Xbox One
Powered by

There are seven endings players can receive in Dead Rising , and though that might sound like a lot, there are some pretty unexpected and outlandish ones thrown in there to make them all feel very distinct from one another. The biggest factor that decides which ending Frank will get depends on how many cases players complete, and whether they can finish certain objectives, such as defusing all of Carlito's explosives.

Whether or not players talk to Isabela near the end of the game, and if they make it to the helipad in the time limit, also play a big part in determining the ending scene, which can range from Frank making it out in time and trying to warn the world of zombies, to him being left behind in the mall to fend for himself. Dead Rising's challenging gameplay and tongue-in-cheek humor, paired with the fun selection of intriguing characters, make it easy to understand why the game is fondly remembered, but the wild variety of endings also plays a part in this.

2 Resident Evil

Not Everyone Is Guaranteed To Make It Out Of The Spencer Mansion In One Piece

8 Images
8 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Resident Evil
9.3 /10
Released
March 22, 1996

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PlayStation (Original), Sega Saturn, Nintendo DS, PC
Powered by

As players navigate their way around the bleak and gloomy Spencer Mansion in the first Resident Evil game, they'll encounter all kinds of terrifying zombies and B.O.Ws that will stand in their way as they try to make a grand escape. At certain points in the game, other characters will ask the player to help them with something, such as saving Chris from danger or even simply handing Barry his magnum.

In the final moments of the game, when the helicopter arrives to carry the survivors to safety, only those who have been treated fairly and kept safe will make it out in time. Technically, the canon ending is that everyone escapes, considering all of them appear in later games, but it still helps to add some weight to the choices players make in between blowing zombie heads off and solving tricky puzzles.

1 Silent Hill 2 Remake

James' Journey Of Self Torment Can End In Drastically Different Ways Depending On The Players' Actions

Your comment has not been saved

Silent Hill 2
9 /10
67
9 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 87 /100 Critics Rec: 94%
Released
October 8, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Bloober Team
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PC
Powered by

As players make their way through the Silent Hill 2 Remake , the game will be keeping tabs on how they behave over the course of a playthrough in order to dictate the ending they receive. Because of how well the game manages to create an intense and immersive atmosphere through its environment and audio design, it means most players will simply do all they can to survive without even thinking about meeting these requirements, which is a testament to just how effectively the game nails its horror gameplay.

However, James' journey of trying to deal with his inner guilt can end in a few different ways. If players spend a little too much time with Maria, for example, they can receive a bad ending where James continues living in his delusion, but if players look back on May's letter and keep themselves healthy for much of the game, James will have a much more hopeful outcome. Silent Hill 2 Remake manages to build upon everything that made the original so great, from the eerie dialogue to the frightening enemy designs, but it also has plenty of memorable and emotional endings to unlock as part of the experience, too.

item.title: RuneScape Dragonwilds Best PC Settings
item.description:
RuneScape Dragonwilds is the latest entry in the series that puts players in an enchanted world full of mystical creatures like huge dragons. Even though the game doesn't have fancy graphical features like Ray Tracing, it's still pretty taxing on your PC. One of the major reasons for the low FPS is the game's status as an early access, which comes with several optimization issues. However, you can try the best settings for RuneScape Dragonwilds to get consistent FPS in your playthrough.

Best Graphics Settings for RuneScape Dragonwilds on PC

RuneScape Dragonwilds has a rather simplistic graphics settings menu without an option to tweak individual graphical components of the game. However, players can still adjust a few settings to boost their FPS. Simply head into the settings and then switch over to the video tab. Here, you'll find all the settings you need to change to make RuneScape Dragonwilds more optimized and fix low FPS.

Settings

Best Preset

Notes

Quality

Medium

The quality is the ultimate setting that will tune all the textures, shadows, level of detail, and other graphical components in the game. Switching to medium ensures a smooth gameplay experience with little quality loss. However, some players may experience texture pop-ins on this setting.

Frame Rate Limit

Dynamic

RuneScape Dragonwilds allow players to set a fixed FPS limit till 140. If you have a monitor with a higher refresh rate, it's best to set the limit as Dynamic, allowing the game to choose the best FPS limit according to the display.

Resolution

Native

Choosing anything lower than the native resolution will make textures blurry.

Upscaling Mode

DLSS or FSR

If you have an Nvidia RTX 40 series GPU, it's best to select the DLSS option here. For all other Nvidia or AMD GPUs, the FSR option will work the best. Why are we selecting FSR for even Nvidia RTX 20 or 30 series cards? It will be explained ahead.

Upscaling Quality

Balanced

Balanced looks quite good, and does not downgrade visuals too much compared to DLAA or quality. This can be bumped up once the game's optimization is improved.

Display Mode

Fullscreen

For best performance, the exclusive fullscreen option works best.

Sharpness

Player's Preference

While using the Balanced preset for upscaling, it's recommended that players at least apply 20% sharpening.

Frame Generation

Enabled

For players on an RTX 40 series GPU, this option will turn on Nvidia DLSS Frame Generation. However, if you're playing on an RTX 30 series or below, an AMD GPU, or even Steam Deck, this option will auto-switch to AMD FSR Frame Generation. So, everyone will be able to boost their FPS with FG in RuneScape Dragonwilds .

Vsync

Disabled

If the Frame Generation option is enabled, turning on Vsync too will introduce unnecessary input lag to the gameplay.

So, these are the best settings for RuneScape Dragonwilds that players can use on PC to fix low FPS and boost performance. Using the settings above on a PC with an i9-14900HX CPU, Nvidia RTX 4080 GPU, and 32GB RAM, the FPS averaged around 85-90, with 1% lows being 70 FPS .

This is a much better result compared to cranking all settings to max and using the DLAA preset in the upscaler, which resulted in an average of 60 FPS performance with dips into the 30s .

Players noticing consistently degrading performance as they play RuneScape Dragonwilds might need to restart their game. This is one of the optimization problems that come with the early access of the game.

5 Images
5 Images

item.title: The Argument For and Against Ascending Astarion in Baldur's Gate 3
item.description:
Baldur's Gate 3 is a massive game that accounts for so many different decisions that it can be difficult to keep track. Major story decisions drive the party forward, but Baldur's Gate 3 's Origin characters in particular also have personal arcs with choices that could have dire consequences.

Astarion's personal story has little to do with the main story of Baldur's Gate 3 , but its themes are very relevant to both the player character and every other party member. His crisis moment happens in Act 3 when he and the party confront Cazador. The player can convince Astarion not to ascend, or to take over Cazador's ritual and become a Vampire Ascendant. Both options have their pros and cons, with different approaches to Baldur's Gate 3 accommodating the two decisions. The choice impacts Astarion dramatically as a character in the aftermath, and magnifies either his worst or best personality traits.

Reasons to Ascend Astarion in Baldur's Gate 3

Cazador's ascendant ritual is an evil-aligned event that was created through a deal with a devil and requires a mass sacrifice. Ascending Astarion requires sacrificing 7,000 people, including Astarion's vampire spawn siblings and some of the victims he lured to Cazador in the past. In exchange, Astarion becomes the most powerful vampire in the Realms, can survive in sunlight without the tadpole, and can turn others into vampire spawn.

There are also mechanical advantages to ascending Astarion, such as gaining Ascended Bite and Misty Escape (Vampire Ascendent) as class actions, and gaining 1d10 Necrotic damage to damage rolls. Another positive to ascending Astarion is that he keeps his invulnerability to sunlight in Baldur's Gate 3 's aftermath. Vampire spawn Astarion loses this invulnerability and is forced to live his life in the darkness once more.

A romanced Astarion will demand submission from the player. Some players find this appealing, but this route isn't for everyone, and also wouldn't work with characters who aren't submissive and who don't value callous ruthlessness.

Reasons to Keep Astarion a Vampire Spawn in Baldur's Gate 3

Discouraging Astarion from completing the ritual and remaining as a vampire spawn doesn't have any upfront advantages, and he doesn't gain anything mechanically. However, there are many story and roleplaying reasons to not Ascend Astarion, especially when romancing Astarion or when playing as a good-aligned character. Players will need to justify killing 7,000 vampire spawn, some of whom are children, while others were just in the wrong place at the wrong time.

Astarion becomes more confident as a vampire ascendant, but this change is arguably for the worse. Ascending Astarion just perpetuates the cycle of abuse that Cazador was trapped in, and he continues it by offering to make the player his vampire spawn. Ascended Astarion also loses all the parts of his personality that make him endearing and worth saving in the first place, such as his emotional vulnerability with the player.

Astarion, as a vampire spawn, is quietly confident, takes pride in how he attains his freedom, respects and trusts the player character, and grows in a healthy way that overcomes the cycle of abuse. Astarion's arc mirrors the other Origin companions and is especially resonant with a redeemed Dark Urge player. Players who want to ascend Astarion need to balance if they want to go the ruthless, power-hungry route that sacrifices Astarion's soul for a couple of mechanical advantages in combat. Or, they could lean into the themes of Baldur's Gate 3 's story and turn Astarion's story into one of the most compelling in the game.

item.title: Apex Legends Update Fixes Annoying Bugs
item.description:
Summary

  • The April 16 update for Apex Legends fixes Lifeline's D.O.C. drone and an issue with players losing weapon charge when using Ballistic.
  • Season 24 has already made changes to classes, Legends, and weapons for better balance.
  • Apex Legends Season 25 is expected to be released at the beginning of May.

Respawn Entertainment has released a new patch for Apex Legends that fixes a couple of frustrating issues impacting players. This new Apex Legends update does not introduce new content, but it should help keep battle royale games fair for those who play Lifeline and Ballistic.

While Apex Legends is over six years old, Respawn has looked to keep balancing the game in various ways in Season 24. So far, this season has reworked the Assault and Skirmisher classes, adding new perks for Apex Legends players. In addition, many alterations to other Legends and weapons have been made. These changes have helped keep the game fresh for the player base and created more exciting battle royale matches. However, some unintended bugs have slipped through the cracks, requiring the developer to take action.

These issues were addressed in an April 16 update and pertained to Lifeline and Ballistic. Specifically, the developer fixed a bug that caused Lifelines D.O.C. drone to malfunction, with some players experiencing an indefinite cooldown. This is good news for Lifeline players, as her Tactical is a significant part of her kit and functions as an important part of her Support role.

Besides the D.O.C. drone fix, Respawn resolved an issue when using a charged Sentinel or Rampage as Ballistic in Apex Legends . According to Respawn, this patch fixes an issue that caused players to lose a charge on these two guns when leveling up their Evo Shield while playing the Legend. Like with Lifeline, this bug was doubtlessly annoying for players, as the Sentinel and Rampage can be considerably more powerful in their charged states.

It is worth noting that these bug fixes follow a previous Apex Legends update for April that made more substantial balance changes. Going beyond bug fixes, that patch buffed Legends like Mirage and Conduit. In addition, it improved the effectiveness of SMGs and the Hemlock while nerfing the P2020 and L-Star.

Time will tell what Respawn has in store for the battle royale game in the remainder of 2025. Season 25 of Apex Legends is less than a month away, meaning the developer might begin teasing new content for the game soon. It is worth pointing out that a new Legend has not been added since Alter in Season 21, so it will be interesting to see if one gets added in the next season. In addition, the Fight Force Event is ongoing, which added new cosmetics, including a Prestige skin for Mirage. Hopefully, whatever comes next for the game will keep the player base engaged.

Apex Legends April 16 Update - Patch Notes

We just pushed a couple of fixes to @PlayApex to address the following issues:

  • Lifeline's tactical drone not working or being put on an indefinite cooldown under certain circumstances
  • Losing charge on a Sentinel or Rampage after leveling up your Evo when playing as Ballistic

item.title: Astro Bot and Donkey Kong Bananza's New Ability May Be a Match Made in Heaven
item.description:
3D platformers have formed the heart of Nintendo's first party output for a long time, and although Mario will be present at the Nintendo Switch 2's launch with Mario Kart World , the system's first big platformer is coming a month later as Donkey Kong Bananza . This is a big surprise for Nintendo fans, even with the gorillas return having been choreographed by a spree of remasters and Nintendo Switch Online releases. Donkey Kong Bonanza will be the first truly 3D Donkey Kong platformer in the franchise since Donkey Kong 64 , so something like this has been a long time coming.

Early footage and previews suggest that Donkey Kong Bananza is more than capable of reaching the high expectations its already amassed, with its literally groundbreaking omnidirectional destruction gimmick being its greatest strength. Depending on the face button pressed, Donkey Kong can punch forward, up, and down, which combines with a Zelda -like climbing system to grant the great ape unparalleled freedom. It's a potentially revolutionary take on a well-established formula, not dissimilar to the Switch 1's Super Mario Odyssey , and good enough for a competitor to take notice.

Astro Bot Is Primed For More Experimental Platforming Mechanics

The Next Astro Bot Game Could Easily Take Inspiration From Donkey Kong

PlayStation's Astro Bot franchise has been around since The Playroom debuted alongside the PlayStation Camera in 2013, but it truly came into its own on the PlayStation 5. Astros Playroom was a pack-in game for the 2020 console, and stood proud as one of the more notable titles available at the systems launch, being praised for its simple yet charming visuals and masterful use of both classic 3D platforming staples and its hardware capabilities. Developer Team Asobi would repeat this feat in 2024 with the considerably-expanded Astro Bot , and managed to solidify both a Game of the Year award winner and a new PlayStation household name in the process.

While some fans would like to see Team Asobi branch out more with its next project, Astro Bot s success has guaranteed a sequel at some point, and it's got a high bar to reach. All the Astro Bot platformers do a surprising amount with what initially seems like simple 3D platforming mechanics, exploring a wide variety of locales and adding on to basic gameplay with various vehicles, transformations, and temporary tools. It's difficult to imagine new mechanics on par with what Astro Bot , Astros Playroom , and even Astro Bot Rescue Mission have already included, but Donkey Kong Bananza could have exactly what the next Astro game needs.

How Donkey Kong Bananzas Tunneling Fits In Astro Bot

In the name of showing off the latest PlayStations capabilities while also showing players a good time, the next Astro installment can copy the tunneling mechanic which Donkey Kong Bananza is based around. This wouldn't be the exact same thing, especially since making it a core mechanic in Astro Bot would quickly give away its inspiration, but it would still embody the core values Astro is looking for when it's in play. Namely, the amount of free-form environmental destruction and reshaping in play could really show off the PlayStation's particles and swift asset loading while also giving players unparalleled freedom.

What Astro Bot Can Do To Make Bananzas Rock-Crushing Its Own

Several avenues for how a new Astro game could include this mechanic already present themselves. Handy-D from Astro Bot and the Monkey Suit from Astros Playroom already possess some of the strength and climbing abilities associated with Donkey Kong, so a new power themed around drills or moles would add some freshness to the idea. It also wouldn't need to stay around for very long, as the level-based structure that Astro games use will keep this ability from upsetting the design in the rest of the game. If Astro Bot can take on Donkey Kong Bananza s greatest strength, it will already be well on its way to producing a worthy sequel.
